name: MG76 Mk. 2 Bullpup Assault Rifle
description: Due to its bullpup configuration, the 90mm MG76 is very compact and lightweight in comparison to its contemporaries, making engaging targets in close quarters almost as easy as those at medium distance. Along with being easy to store and transport, this assault rifle is a common weapon for Federation Mobile Suits. The Mk. 2 MG76 possesses with modifications made after the Battle of Loum. The most noticeable changes is its extended barrel and improved hand grip, allowing for tighter shot placements and increased muzzle velocity. The addition of small tarp coverings over part seams has improved the service lifespan of the MG76 by preventing debris from getting into the weapon whether in space or land combat.

name: BOWA BR-M-79C-1 Beam Spray Gun
description:
The BR-M79-C-1 Beam Spray Gun was designed and developed by BOWA corporation as an Anti-Mobile Suit weapon for the RGM-79.   While the XBR-M-79, the pioneering beam rifle developed by the Federation Military ahead of the Principality of Zeon, would be classified as an long range assault rifle under the previous system of weapon categorization, the Beam Spray Gun falls more into the category of a mid range machine pistol.  
The Beam Spray gun is not equipped with any targeting sensors, but instead relies on the data received from the head sensors of the GM, and the FCS relies on the data supplied from the main mobile suit.  Regardless of the mid-range classification, the official effective range of the weapon remains classified, but slightly surpasses that of the 120mm machine gun utilized by the main Mobile Suit deployed by the Principality of Zeon, the MS-06 Zaku, while still retaining more than sufficient knock down power.

name: THI BSjG01 Beam Saber
description: Stored on the left side of the backpack, it is a small device held in the mobile suit's hands when operated and is powered by a rechargeable energy capacitor. The beam saber emits a blade of plasma contained by an I-Field and can cut through any armor not treated with anti-beam coating.
on_crit: The Beam Saber gains Overkill and an additional 1d3 Energy damage until this attack is resolved.

name: Type 5 Heat Hawk
description: An axe-shaped close combat weapon, it uses a super-heated blade to cut through the armor of enemy MS or vehicles. The thermal energy is generated by the power output of the Zaku II's thermonuclear reactor and relayed through the MS' hands.

name: ZIM/M.T-K175C 175mm Recoilless Rifle
description: The main gun of the HT-01B Magella Attack main battle tank, it is remodeled as an MS artillery weapon. It was mainly used for long distance ground combat and can be loaded with high-explosive anti-tank (HEAT) or armor-piercing fin-stabilized discarding-sabot (APFSDS) rounds.

name: 60mm Vulcan Cannon
description: A basic armament of many Federation mobile suits, a 60mm three-barrel vulcan guns can be mounted in the head and used for mid-range and close combat defense. While generally ineffective against the armor of other mobile suits, they are useful for intercepting incoming missiles/rockets, destroying mobile suit sensors, and attacking lightly-armored vehicles.
effect: This weapon does not take difficulty from being Engaged.

actions.name: Point Defense
actions.detail: Make an attack against the incoming shell. If this attack manages to roll higher than the original attack, nullify damage.

name: Beam Rifle
description: A revolutionary weapon for its time, the beam rifle is the primary weapon of the Gundam. It is a miniaturized version of a mega particle cannon with an output of 1.9 megawatts. The beam rifle employs the Federation's energy capacitor, or E-cap, technology and uses charged concentrations of Minovsky particles as ammunition. The resulting weapon has power equivalent to that of a battleship's main gun at the time of the One Year War, allowing it to defeat a mobile suit with a single shot. The rifle can fire 12-15 shots when fully charged. It also features an offset, movable sensor that interfaces with the RX-78’s Fire Control System (FCS) to achieve a high degree of accuracy, as well as a foregrip for firing support. When not in use, the beam rifle can be stored on the back of the Gundam's waist or behind its shield.

name: ASR-78 MS Anti-Ship Rifle
description: A sniper rifle mainly used against warships. It discharges specialized rounds at a high initial velocity, which can split into submunitions after penetrating a warship's armor, destroying it from within. It is especially devastating when used against the bridge or engine of a ship.
effect: This weapon deals double damage when targeting ships and their subsystems.

name: ZUX-195 Schrotflinte
description: A mobile-suit scale shotgun originally designed for engaging massed conventional armor, the Shrotflinte's mundane name (literally German for "Shotgun") still nevertheless accurately describes its role as a close to mid range weapon like conventional infantry shotguns.

name: MMP-80
description: A lighter alternative to the ZMP, the MMP-80 is a design typically issued to pointmen and squad leaders. Its 90mm shells lack the punch of of the 120mm, however, the cycling action of this weapon is nearly twice as rapid as that of the ZMP, allowing for "spray and pray" dispersal of fire. Couple this with the easier ergonomics, and the MMP becomes a devastatingly effective CQB weapon.

name: "Nutbuster" Gauntlet
description: A semi-official modification of a Zaku's shoulder mounted shield, the "Nutbuster" affixes the slab of armor plating to the Zaku's forearm for use as a makeshift knuckleduster.
effect: As long as this weapon is active, the user's Improvised Attacks deal AP damage.
on_hit: Targets of the same size or smaller than the user's frame must pass a Hull check, or be knocked Prone.

name: 880mmRB-T27 Raketen Bazooka
description: A new heavy bazooka which features powerful rocket-propelled rounds, and improved targeting sensor with protective cover for the aiming module. The bazooka is fed by a 5 rounds clip and spare clips can be carried.
effect: This weapon begins each mission with 5 charges. These charges can be replenished with a stabilize action, as if the weapon were LOADING.

name: Type 5H Heat Halberd
description: Essentially a Heat Hawk which has been upscaled into a Halberd, this weapon now stands as tall as a Zaku, and is famed for being weapon of choice of Dozle Zabi.

name: "Bop" 40mm Missile Launcher
description: Two 4-tube 40mm Bop Missile Launchers are mounted in the Guntank's arms. As the Guntank is not equipped with any close range weapon, the Missile Launchers are also used as the primary defense weapon.

name: WanzerGewehr-89
description: One of a few mobile suit weapons where the bolt of the weapon has to be manually operated, the WanzerGewehr is the brainchild of a particularly eccentric German engineer who took inspiration from American methods of upscaling infantry weapons into mobile suit weapons. The barrel of the rifle was machined with unusually high precision in order to ensure excellent ballistic performance, which also consequently raised the production cost of the weapon. Further compounding this long-range performance and the subsequent price increase is the use of a 76.2mm round based on British anti-tank ammunition that hasn't been in production for over two centuries. The primary ammunition is an Armor-Penetrating Fragmenting Shell, a round that is fitted with an explosive filler that, upon penetrating the target, explodes the round into numerous shrapnel that is intended to cause it and the resulting spalling to ricochet at high speeds inside a mobile suit in order to destroy internal subsystems.
on_crit: Target is Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: MSM700 Riot Cannon
description: Intended originally for situations in where law enforcement mobile suits required more firepower to apprehend hijacked mobile workers, the Riot Cannon can fire a variety of 90mm shells, including traditional tank rounds. However as it’s meant to be used similarly to a police shotgun, its primary ammunition is the Tactical Adhesive Round, or TAR Shells. These “less-than-lethal” shells launch pellets of adhesive material to restrict movement, though mainly intended to delay rather than incapacitate as the adhesive can be broken with enough force from most mobile suits. TAR shells are to be treated with equal caution as their lethal counterparts, as the adhesive itself can hit with enough force to easily shatter human bones and wreck cars given the size of the shell. With the onset of the war, the Riot Cannon has also gotten ammunition designed for it that fires "Mechshot" for engaging actual mobile suits in combat.

profiles.name: TAR Shells
profiles.effect:
On hit: Target must succeed a HULL check or be Impaired and Slowed. These two conditions persist until the target has successfully passed a HULL check rolled at the start of each turn.
On crit: Target suffers the above, and is also knocked Prone.

name: Beam Pike
description: One of several variants of the Beam Saber, the Beam Pike mounts two emitters at the end of a large pole in order to serve as a polearm-type weapon, allowing its wielder to more easily intercept enemy charges and launch melee attacks at an extended reach.

name: AMSR-78-01 Riesenjager
description:
A downscaled version of the ASR-78-02 anti-ship rifle, the Reisenjager is designed for engaging mobile suits at range. With its considerably lighter load up to and including its shell cartridge, the weapon is more suitable in terrestrial combat. The lessened recoil allows for faster follow-up shots and also reduces the strain that the weapon puts on the mobile suit and itself from firing.
A1: Revisions made to the rifle during the course of the war allowed for the rifle to fire more powerful and varied rounds while retaining the same ergonomics as before. One of these rounds is a variant of the Armor-Piercing Fin-Stabilized Sabot called a "Shredder" round, which is designed to rip itself apart upon successful penetration in order to destroy vital subsystems of enemy mobile suits. In addition, electroplating chromium into the interior of the barrel has allowed the rifle to fire more rounds over the lifetime of the barrel before a barrel change is needed.

name: Iron Nails
description: A somewhat uncommon Zeonic weapon design, the Iron Nails affix a series of heavy, reinforced blades to the Mobile Suit's manipulators.

name: Stedken Mk. I
description:
Also registered in Federation armory manifests as the MG79 Type 2, the Stedken Mark One is an alternative to the MG79 developed by Norfolk Heavy Industries. While sharing the same cartridge as the MG79 and capable of accepting the same magazines, the Stedken features its own extended magazine design that stores more ammunition per magazine. The magazine uniquely feeds into the weapon sideways as opposed to from above like the ZMP-50 and MG79 or below like the MMP-80, similar to the Sten and Sterling submachine guns from which the Stedken can trace some of its design lineage from. The Stedken also features an underbarrel cannon that acts similar to a grenade launcher.
While some pilots have programmed their machine to use the magazine as a foregrip for the weapon, it is officially advised against as this increases the chance of a misfeed.

tags.name: OVERKILL
tags.description: When rolling for damage with this weapon, any damage dice that land on a 1 cause the attacker to take 1 Heat, and are then rerolled. Additional 1s continue to trigger this effect.

name: BG-M-79F-3A Beam Gun
description: Developed in cooperation with the BOWA Corporation for the Gunslinger GM, the Beam Gun strikes a medium between the full-sized Beam Rifle and the more compact Beam Spray Gun. Unlike the Beam Spray Gun, the Beam Gun featured a Line-Fire Mode that fires a continuous beam for 1.2 seconds, improving shot accuracy and slicing through an enemy mobile suit's internals.

profiles.name: Burst-Fire Mode
profiles.on_crit: This weapon gains AP until attack is resolved.

profiles.name: Line-Fire Mode
profiles.on_crit: Target must pass an Engineering check or be Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Flare Dispensers
description: A standard feature on most modern military aircraft, decoy flares have changed very little conceptually from their pre-UC counterparts. Commonly composed of a pyrotechnic composition based on magnesium or some other hot-burning metal, these flares are intended to burn hotter than an aircraft's engines in order to confuse infrared-based homing weaponry. These are also often paired with chaff launchers in order to throw off most forms of homing and tracking weaponry such as radar-guided missiles and radar-assisted anti-aircraft guns.

actions.name: Deploy Flares
actions.trigger: Targeted by any weapon with the Smart tag.

name: Heat Saber
description: A rod of superconductive material which uses thermal energy to heat its blade in excess of 3000°C, melting through the armor of an enemy machine. It has an electrical discharge function and can store high charges via the application of Minovsky particle physics. As the heat saber degrades during use, it must be discarded after several uses. Mounted on the back when not in use.
effect: The Heat Saber begins each mission with 5 charges, which may be replenished with a Stabilize action or a Repair.

name: H&L-GB03K/360mm Giant Bazooka
description: A bazooka for MS that fires rocket-propelled 360mm physical rounds. Liquid fuel supplied through a pipe from the Dom's hand is injected as a primary propellant, and then the projectile's speed is increased by rocket motor ignition. It is fed by a 10 rounds magazine, and a single round can cause severe damage to most mobile suit.
effect: This weapon begins each mission with 5 charges. These charges can be replenished with a stabilize action, as if the weapon were LOADING.

name: Heat Rod
description: A close-range weapon installed in the right forearm. This retractable cable delivers a high-voltage electrical shock when it comes into contact with an enemy mobile suit, damaging its internal systems and stunning its pilot. The heat rod could also be superheated to give it cutting properties.
on_crit: The target must pass a Hull check, or be Stunned until the end of their next turn.

name: 75mm Gatling Shield
description: The Gatling shield is combination of a Gatling gun with a modified MS-07B Gouf shield, and grants both offensive and defensive power in a single weapon.
effect: Whenever a frame barrages with this weapon, ranged and melee attacks against it are made with +1 Difficulty until the beginning of its next turn.

name: Ps. IV "Paladin" Beam Saber
description: A Gyan's primary weapon, this beam saber has a higher output than the Earth Federation Forces' beam sabers, and is specialized for piercing/stabbing attack rather than cutting.

tags.name: INACCURATE
tags.description: Attacks made with this weapon receive +1 Difficulty.

name: Magna Hellstar Particle Projector Cannon
description:
The Magna Hellstar GM1012IPPC is a particle cannon that makes use of Deuterium-based ionized particles rather than the Helium-3 derived Minovsky Particle as its ammunition. While not as destructive as a Megaparticle Cannon, the shots fired from the Magna Hellstar PPC can still hit with enough kinetic and thermal energy to burn away metal and buckle structural supports, and the subsequent dispersal of concentrated ionized particles resembles higher levels of Minovsky Particle interference. Firing such a weapon tends to also generate a noticeable amount of waste heat that must be dumped regularly in battle to avoid causing lasting damage to the weapon system and mounting.
This particle model of Particle Projector Cannon garnered particular fame as the main armaments of the MBR-04-Mk.VIC variant of the Destroid Tomahawk, which has been unofficially dubbed by pilots and reporters as the 'Warhammer'.
on_hit: Target must succeed at a ENGINEERING save or become IMPAIRED until the end of their next turn. Until this condition is cleared, their Sensors range is also reduced by 5, to a minimum of 1.

name: Mk. I "Excalibur" Multirole Beam System
description:
An experimental weapon developed by Chief Engineer St. Claire for Mobile Suit Use. The Mk I "Excalibur" is a high throughput beam weapon boasting excellent reach and immense destructive power for its weight class. Under typical circumstances, the weapon's performance is comparable to that of a high intensity beam sword, but its implementation must be limited to a thrusting weapon akin to a lance or spear in order to maintain acceptable safety limits with Mobile Suit-scale Minovsky Reactors.
Without such limitation, the weapon's I-field expands into an immense cutting edge, whose draw and waste heat is much more unstable, erratic, and potentially dangerous. Catastrophic stress to the wielder's reactor is all but inevitable to all but the most skilled pilots.

actions.name: Charge Up!
actions.detail: Release the Excalibur Unit's limiters, exposing a wide-brimmed, long blade which forms along the haft and then some. The damage profile becomes Zweihander Mode as long as you are Charged Up, and for every turn in which Charged Up is active (including the turn on which it is activated), take 3 heat. Disengaging Charged Up can be done as a protocol.

name: Shipbreaker Torpedo
description: Retooled from demolition charges used for shipbreaking obsolete space vessels, Shipbreaker Torpedoes are a form of guided missile that first slams into armor with enough force to cause structural integrity failures before detonating shortly after, sundering the armor of if not outright destroying most targets. This reinforced casing not only increases the amount of shrapnel produced, but makes the Shipbreaker Torpedo much harder to intercept with point-defense fire.
on_attack: The Shipbreaker Mounting is jettisoned, disabling use of this weapon.
on_crit: Inflicts bonus AP Explosive Damage based on double the target's Armor.

name: Mauler Point-Defense Laser Cannon
description: The Mauler Point-Defense Laser Cannon is a high-energy laser weapon that are mounted as either a singular or pair of "horns" on the Phoenix's head module. Moderately effective against unprotected aircraft, the Mauler's real utility is in its capability of quickly shooting down incoming missiles. Linked to the pilot's heads-up display, the Mauler can rapidly track targets to shoot down through the pilot's eye movements, similar to how target acquisition for most modern aerial weapons work.

actions.name: Intercept
actions.detail: Roll a SYSTEMS check. On a success, the missile(s) is shot down by the Mauler Point-Defense Laser Cannon. If a Main Rifle is mounted in the Flex Mount, may opt to use it instead of the Mauler Laser Cannon to Intercept. Taking this reaction allows the Mauler Laser Cannon to be used for a separate Intercept reaction, but forgoes using the Overwatch reaction for the current round.
actions.trigger: An enemy Launcher attack targets anyone within a Burst 5 zone or intersects it.

name: UHPH-10 Poseidon Hydrocannon
description: This weapon’s profile is determined by the number of Charges it carries. It begins with 1 Charge. Each time you begin or end your turn in a water source, you gain an additional 1 Charge, up to a maximum of 4.

profiles.name: 2 Charges
profiles.effect: The weapon may fire with the Line OR Cone profile.

profiles.name: 3 Charges
profiles.effect: The weapon my fire with the Line OR Cone profile.

profiles.name: 4 Charges
profiles.effect: The weapon may fire with the Line OR Cone profile.
profiles.on_hit: Target becomes SHREDDED for the remainder of the scene.

name: Howard three-barrel GPU-9 35mm Gun Pod
description: Variable Frame Gun Pod, designed to allow the VF-0 a measure of firepower at all times, in any mode, be it Gerwalk, Battroid or Fighter mode.

tags.name: RELIABLE {VAL}
tags.description: This weapon has some degree of self-correction or is simply powerful enough to cause damage even with a glancing blow. It always does {VAL} damage, even if it misses its target or rolls less damage. Reliable damage inherits other tags (such as AP) and base damage type but not tags that require a hit, such as Knockback.

tags.name: OVERKILL
tags.description: When rolling for damage with this weapon, any damage dice that land on a 1 cause the attacker to take 1 Heat, and are then rerolled. Additional 1s continue to trigger this effect.

name: GU-11 55 mm Three-Barrel Gatling Gun Pod
description: Early production next-generation variable frame gun pod, designed to replace the aging GPU-9.

tags.name: OVERKILL
tags.description: When rolling for damage with this weapon, any damage dice that land on a 1 cause the attacker to take 1 Heat, and are then rerolled. Additional 1s continue to trigger this effect.

tags.name: ARMOR-PIERCING (AP)
tags.description: Damage dealt by this weapon ignores Armor.

tags.name: INACCURATE
tags.description: Attacks made with this weapon receive +1 Difficulty.

name: Heat Tendrils
on_hit: If the the target is the same size as or smaller than the user, the target must succeed an AGILITY save, or be pulled adjacent to the user. The user may then attempt to grapple as a free action. If the target is larger, they are unaffected.
on_crit: In addition to being automatically pulled adjacent, the target is automatically grappled. Does not apply to larger targets.

tags.name: EXOTIC GEAR
tags.description: EXOTIC GEAR is a general tag for equipment that exists outside the traditional licensing system.

name: Assault Beam Cannon
description: One of the first Zeon beam weapons built with E-Caps, the Assault Beam Cannon fires a rapid barrage of short-burst beams rather than a prolonged beam. While this sacrifices some individual power compared to other beam weapons, this makes it much more effective in close quarters combat. Commonly equipped on the Hygogg, where an internal feed system in its forearms handles cycling the E-Caps.

tags.name: LOADING
tags.description: This weapon must be reloaded after each use. Mechs can reload with Stabilize and some systems.

name: Ps. V Crusader Beam Lance
description: A high powered beam lance, more suited for charging attacks than the original Gyan's beam sword.
effect: For every space moved in a straight line within the turn prior to using this weapon, the Beam Lance deals an additional +1 energy damage, to a maximum of 12.

tags.name: ARMOR-PIERCING (AP)
tags.description: Damage dealt by this weapon ignores Armor.

tags.name: INACCURATE
tags.description: Attacks made with this weapon receive +1 Difficulty.

tags.name: HEAT {VAL} (SELF)
tags.description: Immediately after using this weapon or system, the user takes {VAL} Heat.

tags.name: UNIQUE
tags.description: This weapon or system cannot be duplicated – each character can only have one copy of it installed at a time.

name: Hi-B 80 Megaparticle Cannon
effect: While HIDDEN, roll this weapon's attack twice, and take the higher result.

tags.name: ARMOR-PIERCING (AP)
tags.description: Damage dealt by this weapon ignores Armor.

tags.name: HEAT {VAL} (SELF)
tags.description: Immediately after using this weapon or system, the user takes {VAL} Heat.

name: Type 700 Mega Flamethrower
effect: This weapon may use either the Cone 4 or Line 8 pattern when resolving an attack.

tags.name: OVERKILL
tags.description: When rolling for damage with this weapon, any damage dice that land on a 1 cause the attacker to take 1 Heat, and are then rerolled. Additional 1s continue to trigger this effect.

tags.name: HEAT {VAL} (SELF)
tags.description: Immediately after using this weapon or system, the user takes {VAL} Heat.

tags.name: UNIQUE
tags.description: This weapon or system cannot be duplicated – each character can only have one copy of it installed at a time.

name: ZMP-50D2
description: The primary weapon of the Zaku II mobile suit and in turn the most common MS weapon, the ZMP-50D is fairly effective against enemy mobile suits and dangerous against conventional vehicles. While each round is somewhat weaker than those used by tanks in order to accommodate its fully automatic action, a burst of these rounds can cause major damage to most tanks. Its pan magazine allows for a larger number of shells to be stored.Further upgrades were made to the ZMP-50D after encountering difficulty against the armor of mid-war Earth Federation mobile suits and even main battle tanks, resulting in the ZMP-50D2 model. This upgraded version includes two different specialty ammunition for dealing with vehicles and mobile suits in the form of HEAT and Mechshot shells respectively.

tags.name: INACCURATE
tags.description: Attacks made with this weapon receive +1 Difficulty.

name: HB-L-03/N-STD Hyper Bazooka
description:
The HB-L-03/N-STD Hyper Bazooka was developed by the BLASH corporation as a general purpose fire support rocket launcher platform for Mobile Suits.   With considerable destructive power owing to the explosive yield in each warhead, the weapon was primarily used to destroy less-maneuverable battlefield targets such as warships, satellites, land battleships, bunkers, and buildings. This weapon was created with input from several of the Federation’s long range weaponry suppliers, and developed to meet the need for a recoilless rocket launcher that could be adapted to a variety of deployment situations.
While possessing relatively simple construction, the HB-L-03/N-STD has a long barrel as well as considerable ammunition weight in the rear, with the center of gravity being maintained near the center, but a specialized manual was also prepared to prevent maneuvers from being affected by the additional weight, and the fire control program was also responsible for limiting the Mobile Suit’s range of motion.
effect: This weapon begins each mission with 5 charges. These charges can be replenished with a stabilize action, as if the weapon were LOADING.

profiles.name: Iron Nail
profiles.effect: The Iron Nail cannot be Thrown. Instead, if the wielder begins their turn HIDDEN, the Iron Nail uses the Hidden Strike attack profile.

profiles.name: Hidden Strike
profiles.on_hit: Target must pass a hull check, or become SHREDDED until the beginning of their next turn,

tags.name: ARMOR-PIERCING (AP)
tags.description: Damage dealt by this weapon ignores Armor.

name: BOWA XBR-H-79 Beam Rifle
description: The prototype model of the beam rifle used by the RX-78 series, the XBR-H-79 is a less refined, but no less deadly beam rifle. The weapon's firing mechanism feeds a series of beam caps, whose complicated charging process requires specialized equipment and a massive power source, in exchange for bringing the power of a battleship-grade megaparticle cannon to the field. Nevertheless, the logistics involved typically makes this a weapon reserved for fleet escort and rear guard units.

tags.name: ARMOR-PIERCING (AP)
tags.description: Damage dealt by this weapon ignores Armor.

tags.name: LIMITED {VAL}
tags.description: This weapon or system can only be used {VAL} times before it requires a Full Repair. Some Limited systems, like Grenades, describe these uses as “charges”. To use the system, the user expends a charge.

name: H&L-SB25K/280mmA-P Zaku Bazooka
description: A portable, physical projectile-type firearm. It is primarily for anti-ship combat and displays its power in hit and run attacks. It can also be used against enemy mobile suits, but it is harder to hit a constantly moving target. The bazooka could be stored on the rear waist armor, while spare ammunition clip containing 4 rounds could be stored on the side waist armor.
effect: This weapon begins each mission with 4 charges. These charges can be replenished with a stabilize action, as if the weapon were LOADING.

tags.name: ARMOR-PIERCING (AP)
tags.description: Damage dealt by this weapon ignores Armor.

name: RGM-M-Sh-003 Tower Shield
description:
The RGM-M-Sh-003 series was first proposed as Anti Mobile Suit defensive equipment on the RX project, and the Sh-003 type is essentially identical to that used on RX-series units.
Composed of Luna Titanium Alloys, and almost completely proof against heavy weapon rounds, the Sh-003 proved to be resistant against 120mm Zaku Machine Gun fire, with even short range fire completely unable to penetrate the shield, deflecting most of the rounds that impacted the shield.

actions.name: Raise Shield
actions.detail: Gain resistance to Kinetic and Explosive damage, and act as Hard Cover for adjacent allies. Also become SLOWED, and all ranged weapon attacks suffer a penalty of +2 Difficulty. This can be deactivated as a Quick Action or Protocol.

tags.name: THROWN {VAL}
tags.description: This melee weapon can be thrown at targets within {VAL} spaces. Thrown attacks follow the rules for melee attacks but are affected by cover; additionally, a thrown weapon comes to rest in an adjacent space to its target and must be retrieved as a free action while adjacent to that weapon before it can be used again.

tags.name: SHIELD
tags.description: This system is an energy shield of some kind.

name: RGM(S)-Sh-WF/S-00109 Shield
description: Mounted on the forearm, this small, light shield is commonly used by the Gundam Ground Type and GM Ground Type. Constructed of Luna Titanium alloy, it is designed to primarily protect the cockpit and other critical areas, and as such has a different form than the RGM-M-Sh-003 model. Additionally, it can be used as a close-range striking weapon in mobile suit combat. Furthermore, through lodging the spikes at the tip into the ground, the shield can serve as a free-standing frontal defense. This also allows the mobile suit to use both hands to hold large caliber weaponry and maintain a stable firing position.

actions.name: Buckler Defense
actions.detail: Select one hostile character within Line of Sight. If this character uses a Skirmish (but not Barrage) action against you, you are considered to have Resistance to Kinetic and Explosive damage until the attack is resolved. You may switch targets as a Protocol.

tags.name: SHIELD
tags.description: This system is an energy shield of some kind.

name: 40mm Missile Shield
effect: As an Overwatch reaction, you may gain Resistance to one instance of Kinetic damage. You may also make a free attack with the 40mm Missile Shield against the attacker, so long as they are within Range.

actions.name: Hide Bombs
actions.detail: 2/scene, deploy Hide Bombs in a Burst 2 area. Hide Bombs are considered Mines, with a Damage Profile of 1d3 Explosive.

tags.name: SHIELD
tags.description: This system is an energy shield of some kind.

name: Scattering Beam Cannon
description: A beam weapon mounted on the left side of the Dom's chest, the scattering beam cannon was only powerful enough to produce an intense, bright flash that could momentarily blind human eyes and visual sensors. At close range, the beam was also capable of dissipating I-fields, rendering weapons that depended on I-fields to focus and shape a cohesive blade of energy, such as the Beam Saber, inert for short periods.
on_hit: The target must succeed on a Systems check. On failure, the target may only draw line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn.
on_crit: Additionally, the target must succeed on an Engineering check, or have all weapons that deal Energy damage disabled until they Stabilize.

tags.name: SMART
tags.description: This weapon has self-guidance systems, self-propelled projectiles, or even nanorobotic ammunition. These systems are effective enough that its attacks can’t simply be dodged – they must be scrambled or jammed. Because of this, all attacks with this weapon – including melee and ranged attacks – use the target’s E-Defense instead of Evasion. Targets with no E-Defense count as having 8 E-Defense.

tags.name: LOADING
tags.description: This weapon must be reloaded after each use. Mechs can reload with Stabilize and some systems.
